text: Ernest Willard Gibson (December 29, 1872June 20, 1940) was an American politician and lawyer. He was a member of the United States House of Representatives from Vermont between 1923 and 1933. He was a United States Senator from 1933 until his death in 1940. His son, Ernest W. Gibson Jr. replaced him. ==References== ==Other websites== * Biographical Directory of the United States Congress: GIBSON, Ernest Willard, (1872 - 1940) * The Political Graveyard: Gibson, Ernest Willard (1872-1940) * Govtrack.us: Sen. Ernest Gibson * * (Gibson gave the dedicatory address; he can be seen at the 49 second mark seated third from the left in the foreground.) title: Ernest Willard Gibson
